column4: I have headphones that plugin to my comuter using the green and pink + USB ports at the front of my computer, and they go out one of the ports in the back of the computer and plugin to my Xbox 360, (I think it's In-line or something?) anyways, when I was on Windows I could hear the Xbox sounds, when using Ubuntu i can't
Any ideas..?
sounds like you have some connections mismatched

the connections are fine because i haven't changed them since I was on Windows, but I remember this happening before and I had to make another sound device default in the Windows Sound control panel..
in ubuntu 11.04 standard gnome 2.? is an option at GDM login
is this a windows problem or Ubuntu?
Ubuntu, i need to make another sound device default in Ubuntu, like I did once before in Windows so i could hear my Xbox 360 sounds through my headphones.
not knowing particualrs on your system or your setup I would say to go into sound preferences and check your settings
make sure you have input output going to proper devices.
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=657593 describes my problem.
k, reading
may sound like im being picky but did you try the fix mentioned there?
I just found it like a second ago, trying it now.. :3
ok cool
Good luck
I don't know what to turn up or down -_-
now the sound on Ubuntu won't work at all -_-
open sound preferences from the sound icon on top bar
go to hardware tab, and see if it has a hardware listing for both your pc soundcard/chip and your xbox
it's open.
your sound preferences / hardware has bot sound sources listed?
